items.title: Chiraharit IPO: Moderate GMP signals cautious optimism ahead of listing
items.description: Chiraharit's SME IPO closed with decent subscription, driven by retail investors, and will list on October 8. The company, which provides EPC solutions for water and renewable energy, aims to expand its manufacturing capabilities. Analysts anticipate modest listing gains of 5-10% due to a cautious market and small issue size.

items.title: Zelio E-Mobility shares to list today. GMP hints at flattish debut ahead
items.description: Zelio E-Mobility's initial public offering is set for its BSE SME debut on October 8. The IPO closed with moderate investor interest and no grey market premium. The company manufactures electric two and three-wheelers. Its revenue and profit have shown significant growth. The debut is anticipated to be cautious due to subscription levels.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 11 stocks close cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty500 pack, 11 stocks' closing prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on October 7, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used by traders as a key indicator for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Sheel Biotech IPO: Healthy GMP and decent subscription signal a steady listing
items.description: Sheel Biotech, a leader in agri-biotech solutions, is set for its NSE SME debut on October 8 with a Rs 34 crore IPO. The company, boasting over three decades of experience in tissue culture and organic farming, saw strong investor demand, with its issue subscribed nearly 16 times. Financials show steady growth, and IPO proceeds will fuel expansion.

items.title: Sunsky Logistics IPO: Muted response and GMP hint at flat debut
items.description: Sunsky Logistics is set for its BSE SME debut on October 8 following a modest IPO subscription of 1.46 times, with retail investors showing under-subscription. The grey market shows no premium, indicating muted sentiment. The company, offering multimodal logistics services, raised Rs 16.84 crore and reported sharp financial growth on a small base.

items.title: Infinity Infoway IPO: Massive subscription and GMP driving strong listing buzz
items.description: Infinity Infoway's initial public offering is poised for a strong market debut on October 8. The company's Rs 24.42 crore IPO saw overwhelming investor interest, with a subscription rate of 277.24 times. A healthy grey market premium of Rs 45 per share suggests a potential listing price between Rs 195 and Rs 200.

items.title: Munish Forge IPO listing today. GMP suggests cautious debut ahead
items.description: Munish Forge's Rs 73.92 crore IPO closed subscribed 3.53 times, with strong participation from QIBs and non-institutional investors. Despite healthy demand, the stock shows no grey market premium, suggesting a flat listing. The company, a key supplier to defence and auto sectors, reported significant profit growth in FY25.

items.title: Wall Street retreats from record closing highs as economic worries mount
items.description: Indian markets mirrored global trends as US stocks ended lower on Tuesday. Investors sought clues from secondary data and Federal Reserve officials due to a government shutdown. Consumer sentiment surveys showed declining future expectations and rising inflation projections. Economically sensitive sectors underperformed. Tesla shares dropped, while AMD and IBM saw gains. Bitcoin-related stocks reversed recent advances.

items.title: L&T set for momentum breakout, says Ruchit Jain of Motilal Oswal
items.description: “L&T stock is on the verge of a breakout from this consolidation, and recent price volume action has turned bullish as the volumes have been increasing gradually. Traders can buy for a target above 4000 in the next few weeks,” Ruchit Jayantilal Jain, VP, Head – Equity Technical Research at Motilal Oswal Financial Services Limited, said.

items.title: Asian stocks slip at open, gold close to $4,000
items.description: Asian equities experienced a modest decline, mirroring Wall Street's retreat from record highs due to concerns about an overheated market. Technology shares were among the decliners, with a US-listed Chinese shares index falling significantly. The yen also weakened against the dollar, influenced by a leadership change in Japan's ruling party.

items.title: Banks to seek competing bid for Rs 729-cr Sahara Star Hotel debt
items.description: Banks are seeking higher offers for the Sahara Star Hotel's debt. Union Bank of India leads the process. JC Flowers ARC had previously offered ₹279 crore for the ₹729 crore debt. Banks aim for a minimum bid of ₹293 crore. The hotel is a valuable property with full security for the loans. An auction is expected soon.

items.title: RBI in no hurry to launch digital currency: T Rabi Shankar
items.description: The Reserve Bank of India has no immediate plans for a nationwide CBDC launch, prioritizing cross-border arrangements and pilot projects for specific use cases like subsidy schemes. Deputy Governor T Rabi Shankar indicated that progress has slowed compared to previous years, emphasizing the need for international coordination.

items.title: 'Deposit tokenisation' pilot to be set in motion on October 8
items.description: The Reserve Bank of India will start a deposit tokenisation pilot on October 8. This initiative will create digital representations of assets like deposits. The pilot will use the wholesale segment of its central bank digital currency. Several banks are collaborating on this project. Tokenisation aims to make transactions faster, cheaper, and safer.

items.title: Ex-IndusInd banker traded on Kesoram-UltraTech deal info
items.description: A former IndusInd Bank official's wife traded Kesoram Industries shares after learning of acquisition talks. She profited significantly. The official also traded other company shares through family members, earning over ₹32 crore. He shared this information with colleagues. The bank is investigating and cooperating with SEBI. This comes after previous accounting irregularities at IndusInd Bank.

items.title: GIFT Nifty down 20 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Nifty closed slightly higher on Tuesday as markets reacted to pre-quarterly business updates ahead of the Q2FY26 results season. Analysts anticipate Indian equities to trade within a range, with stock-specific movements driven by sectoral developments and upcoming earnings. The India VIX saw a slight decrease, indicating reduced market fear.

items.title: Dotcom fears rise with tech stocks seeing $100-billion swings
items.description: Wall Street professionals are increasingly concerned about the rapid, massive gains in tech stocks, fueled by OpenAI's expansion and deals with companies like AMD and Oracle. These dramatic market value increases, reminiscent of the dot-com era, are raising fears of an unhealthy bubble and a potential market crash.

items.title: JSW Steel shares in focus as Supreme Court refuses to quash money laundering proceedings
items.description: JSW Steel shares are under scrutiny after the Supreme Court refused to halt money laundering proceedings related to the Obulapuram Mining Company (OMC) case. The apex court allowed the statutory process to continue, focusing on whether Rs 33.80 crore withdrawn by JSW Steel constitutes proceeds of crime.

items.title: Indraprastha Gas among 7 F&O stocks with sharp rise in futures open interest
items.description: As of October 7, there was a notable surge in futures open interest across nine stocks in the NSE F&O segment, leading to an overall increase of over 7% compared with the previous trading session. A sharp rise in futures open interest indicates a substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts for a given security. This uptrend suggests that more participants are either initiating new positions or adding to their existing ones in the futures market.Stocks with the highest jump in futures open interest:

items.title: LG India IPO buzzing! But are investors missing the risks?
items.description: LG Electronics India, the consumer durables and home appliances giant, has kicked off its Rs 11,607 crore IPO, one of the biggest public issues of 2025.The offer, which opened on Tuesday, October 7, will close on Thursday, October 9. The price band? Between Rs 1,080 & Rs 1,140 per share.It’s a pure Offer For Sale, which means the Indian arm won’t get any of the IPO proceeds – the entire amount goes to the South Korean parent, LG Electronics. After this issue, the promoter will still hold 85% stake, so the public float will remain limited. But under Sebi’s new rules, LG will have 5 years to meet the minimum public shareholding norms.

items.title: India's mid, small-cap firms to lead equities higher, Abakkus chief says
items.description: Mid- and small-cap Indian companies are poised to lead future equity market gains, driven by growth in new-age sectors like renewables and digital platforms. Despite recent underperformance and foreign investor outflows, a turnaround is anticipated due to easing interest rates, GST reforms, and a favorable monsoon.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei struggles as stimulus optimism counters profit-taking at record highs
items.description: Japan's Nikkei share average traded flat as stimulus hopes clashed with profit-taking after reaching record highs.  The yen's slide boosted exporters, while the RSI indicated an overheated market.  Heavy machinery and AI suppliers saw gains, contrasting with declines in SoftBank Group and Tokyo Electron.

items.title: BGR Energy Systems among 6 stocks witnessing a 5-year swing high breakout
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks with a market cap over Rs 1000 crore, six stocks witnessed a 5-year swing high at the close on October 7, suggesting bullishness in counters, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year timeframe. This level acts as a significant resistance point where the price has historically struggled to go beyond. This occurrence may be seen as a bullish sign, indicating the potential for further upward movement in the stock. However, it's worth noting that this is different from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when a stock's price surpasses a key resistance level that has held for five years or longer.

items.title: Tilaknagar Industries shares in focus as CCI approves Rs 4,150 cr acquisition of Imperial Blue whisky biz
items.description: Tilaknagar Industries share price: Tilaknagar Industries received CCI approval to acquire Pernod Ricard India’s Imperial Blue whisky business for Rs 4,150 crore, including a deferred payment of Rs 282 crore. The deal, executed as a slump sale, strengthens Tilaknagar’s position in India’s growing whisky market.

items.title: Titan Shares in focus after 20% YoY growth, robust international performance in Q2 update
items.description: Titan Company reported 20% year-on-year growth in Q2FY26, driven by strong jewellery sales and an 86% surge in international revenue led by Tanishq. The company added 55 new stores, expanding its total footprint to 3,377 across domestic and overseas markets.

items.title: Tata Motors shares in focus after JLR reports 17% YoY decline in Q2 retail sales
items.description: Tata Motors share price: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), Tata Motors’ UK-based luxury vehicle arm, reported a 17% YoY decline in Q2FY26 retail sales to 85,495 units due to a cyber attack that disrupted production, alongside challenges from the wind-down of Jaguar models and higher US tariffs.

items.title: Bharti Airtel, M&M among 8 stocks signalling bullish RSI momentum
items.description: Eight stocks from the NSE largecap pack were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan on October 7, based on data from stockedge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the stock's price. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: Elecon Engineering, Trent among 4 stocks that could give 15-47% return
items.description: Brokerages remain optimistic on select stocks across engineering, retail, insurance, and consumer electronics sectors, citing strong fundamentals and healthy earnings visibility for the next 12 months.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: BAG Convergence IPO listing today. Check GMP ahead of debut
items.description: BAG Convergence's IPO is set to list on the NSE SME platform on October 8, following a moderate subscription of 1.38 times and a flat grey market premium of Rs 0. The digital media company, which raised Rs 13.57 crore from anchor investors, saw lukewarm retail participation.

items.title: Mukul Agarwal picks 7.6% stake in this multibagger stock that’s up over 200% in just 1 year
items.description: Osel Devices rose sharply after Mukul Agarwal picked up a 7.6% stake in the multibagger smallcap, which has surged over 200% in the past year. The company, a maker of LED displays and hearing aids, continues strong momentum, gaining 63% in three months and 90% in six months.

items.title: Tech Trouble: Nifty IT sinks, but Infosys and HCL Tech emerge as “BUY” opportunities
items.description: Nifty IT Index has dropped nearly 11% in the last three months as macro pressures, pricing challenges, and weak client demand weigh on the sector. Despite the broader slowness, HDFC Securities upgrades Infosys and HCL Tech to “BUY” on attractive valuations and AI-driven growth, while mid-tier IT companies may see muted performance in FY26.

items.title: LG Electronics India IPO enters Day 2: Here’s what top 10 brokerages recommend
items.description: LG Electronics’ Rs 11,607-crore IPO has received a positive response from analysts, given the company’s market leadership in home appliances, robust profitability, and expansion plans. The issue, entirely an offer for sale by parent LG Electronics Inc, opened on October 7 and will close on October 9, with a price band of Rs 1,080-1,140 per share. Most brokerages have issued a Subscribe call, citing its strong brand, reasonable valuations, and sector tailwinds.

items.title: Tata Steel shares are up 25% in 2025. Can the rally hold above Rs 175?
items.description: Tata Steel has surged 25% in 2025, supported by a global metals rally fueled by U.S. rate cut expectations, a weaker dollar, and EU tariff hikes on Chinese steel. The stock is consolidating in a Rs 166–175 range, and analysts say a decisive close above Rs 175 could trigger the next leg higher, attracting more buyers.

items.title: Miran advocates faster rate cuts amid moderating inflation
items.description: Fed Governor Miran urged swift and aggressive U.S. rate cuts, citing calm bond markets, moderating inflation, and reliable government data, while emphasising democratic accountability and leadership in economic agencies.

items.title: Sanae Takaichi victory sparks optimism in Japanese stocks
items.description: Sanae Takaichi has won Japan’s leadership race in a surprising result, becoming the country’s next prime minister. As a protégé of the late Shinzo Abe, her victory has sparked speculation on whether she will bring back stimulus-friendly policies reminiscent of Abe’s famous “Abenomics.” (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Perplexity's Chrome-killer browser can buy stocks for you on Zerodha? Arvind Srinivas reacts to viral Reddit post
items.description: A Reddit post claims Perplexity’s Comet Browser executed stock trades on Zerodha and applied for an IPO using simple AI commands. CEO Arvind Srinivas shared it, highlighting Comet’s potential to automate complex financial tasks via natural language prompts.

items.title: Listing slump! Om Freight Forwarders shares debut at 40% discount over IPO price
items.description: Om Freight Forwarders shares debuted on Dalal Street with a significant 40% discount to its IPO price, opening at Rs 82.50 on BSE and Rs 81.50 on NSE. Despite a healthy IPO subscription and strong fundamentals, market participants cited cautious sentiment towards mid-sized logistics IPOs for the muted listing.

items.title: Strong Start! Advance Agrolife shares list at 14% premium over IPO price
items.description: Advance Agrolife made a strong stock market debut, listing at a premium of 13-14% on both NSE and BSE. The Rs 193-crore IPO saw robust subscription, with the NII segment being a standout performer. The agrochemical manufacturer's diverse product range and positive sector outlook support its valuation.

items.title: Anant Raj shares tumble 4% after launching QIP, sets floor price at Rs 695.83
items.description: Shares of Anant Raj Ltd fell up to 4% on October 8 after the company’s board approved a qualified institutional placement (QIP) of equity shares with a floor price of Rs 695.83.. The move aims to raise capital efficiently in accordance with SEBI regulations. The stock has surged over 30% in the last month amid government plans for tax incentives for data centre developers and the company’s ambitious expansion plans.

items.title: From ETFs to Bars: Multiple ways for investors to capitalize on rising gold prices
items.description: Gold surged above $4,000 per ounce on Wednesday, marking a record high. This rise is driven by investors seeking safety amid growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty, alongside expectations of further interest rate cuts by the U.S. Federal Reserve. So far this year, gold has gained 52%, fuelled by central bank buying, monetary policy easing, and a weaker dollar. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Godrej Consumer shares in focus as company sees steady Q2 growth amid GST tailwinds
items.description: Godrej Consumer shares: The company projected mid-single-digit consolidated revenue growth for Q2 FY26, supported by GST rate cuts and steady performance across markets. Nearly one-third of its portfolio—including soaps, shampoos, talcum powders, and shaving creams—now faces a reduced GST rate of 5%, down from 18%.

items.title: Sensex up over 200 pts, Nifty tops 25,150 as D-St extends winning run for day 5
items.description: Indian equities continued their upward trend for a fifth consecutive session on Wednesday, with the Sensex and Nifty opening higher. Investors remained optimistic ahead of quarterly earnings, with IT stocks spearheading the gains. However, analysts cautioned that profit-taking might moderate the advance later in the day.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Nuvama raises target price on Lodha Developers; sees over 25% upside in Godrej Consumer
items.description: Brokerages remain bullish on Titan, Lodha Developers, and Godrej Consumer, citing strong growth potential, resilient demand, and structural drivers despite short-term challenges, with upside targets of 22–41% across sectors.

items.title: Eimco Elecon shares soar over 12% after Vijay Kedia picks up Rs 11 crore stake via bulk deal
items.description: Eimco Elecon shares: Ace investor Vijay Kedia, through Kedia Securities Pvt Ltd, acquired shares worth Rs 11 crore via a bulk deal at Rs 1,906.71 per share, a 4.4% premium to the previous close.

items.title: Vodafone Idea among 7 stocks that closed above VWAP on Oct 7
items.description: On October 7, the closing prices of seven stocks in the Nifty500 pack rose over 1% above their VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price), indicating a potential bullish trend, according to StockEdge.com technical scan data.A closing price above the VWAP means the stock ended the day higher than the average price at which it traded, weighted by volume. Traders and investors often interpret this as a bullish signal, suggesting positive market sentiment.

items.title: Ray Dalio says gold should make up 15% of portfolios amid credit-dependent markets
items.description: Gold’s surge past US$4,000 an ounce has drawn strong support from billionaire Ray Dalio, who recommends holding about 15% of portfolios in gold as a hedge against credit risk. Amid a robust 2025 rally and economic uncertainty, Dalio views gold as both a structural safeguard and a timely investment opportunity.

items.title: From Rs 50 crore to Rs 130 crore in 7 months! Ashish Kacholia firm makes 156% return in Jain Resource Recycling
items.description: Dubbed the “Big Whale” of Dalal Street for his early bets on emerging firms, Ashish Kacholia invested Rs 50 crore in Jain Resource Recycling via his Bengal Finance & Investments arm on March 13, 2025, acquiring 7,83,375 shares at an average cost of Rs 638.28 each.

items.title: NBFCs set for strongest earnings in six quarters. 10 stocks to buy ahead of Q2 results
items.description: According to Motilal Oswal, the NBFC-lending sector is expected to post a robust 21% year-on-year earnings growth in Q2 FY26, the highest in six quarters and well ahead of most other sectors. The strong momentum is led by healthy credit demand, stable margins, and improving asset quality. Here are the 10 top NBFC stocks Motilal Oswal recommends ahead of Q2 results.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei snaps 4-session winning run as record valuations prompt profit-taking
items.description: Japan's Nikkei share average snapped a four-session winning streak on Wednesday, as profit-taking after a run-up to record levels outweighed optimism over a potential increase in stimulus.

items.title: European shares rise slightly on banks, energy boost; tech, autos curb gains
items.description: European shares inched higher on Wednesday with banks and energy stocks leading early gains, though gains were kept in check by losses in automobile stocks following BMW's forecast cut and technology names amid U.S. calls for export bans.

items.title: Nykaa shares hover around their all-time high level. Should investors ride the trend or wait?
items.description: FSN E-Commerce Ventures, Nykaa's parent company, is experiencing a significant stock rally. The share price is near its 52-week high, showing strong gains over recent weeks and months. Technical analysis indicates a positive trend with potential for further upward movement. Investors are showing renewed interest in digital platforms, boosting Nykaa's performance. Experts suggest continued buying opportunities with specific price targets.

items.title: Tata Motors demerger effect: Shares lose steam, slip 7% in 4 days. What investors need to know
items.description: Tata Motors shares have dropped 6.8% in four sessions to ₹689.3 on the BSE, falling below ₹700 as investors await the record date for its demerger next week. The decline reflects concerns over the separation of commercial and passenger vehicle businesses and the phased restart of Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) production following a September cyberattack.

items.title: Market signals and your SIP: Using technical trends to fine-tune systematic investing
items.description: Indian investors are enhancing wealth creation through SIPs by integrating technical analysis. This approach helps time investments, optimize cost averaging, and counter emotional decisions during market volatility. Tools like RSI and moving averages guide adjustments, potentially boosting returns by 2-3% annually. Accessible fintech platforms empower retail investors to make informed, data-driven choices.

items.title: Gold jumps 56%, silver 69% but jewellery stocks tumble 36% in 2025. Where is the money flowing?
items.description: Jewellery stocks have tumbled in 2025 despite strong Q1 earnings, with Senco Gold, Sky Gold, and Kalyan Jewellers posting PAT growth of 48-105%. Margin pressure and soaring gold and silver prices are dampening investor sentiment, while ETFs and electronic gold gain popularity. Experts advise caution, recommending focus on large, diversified players like Titan and Kalyan amid mixed near-term prospects.

items.title: Navi Mumbai airport: Lodha big beneficiary, stock can rally 46%, says Jefferies
items.description: The upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport could transform Mumbai’s property landscape. Jefferies identifies Lodha Developers as a major beneficiary, citing its extensive land holdings and surrounding infrastructure upgrades. Despite recent share declines, the brokerage projects significant upside, driven by land value appreciation and ongoing monetisation of Lodha’s assets.

items.title: Rekha Jhunjhunwala mints over Rs 700 crore in minutes on Titan Q2 update. Should you buy?
items.description: Titan Share Price: Rekha Jhunjhunwala’s stake in Titan Company surged by about ₹739 crore on Wednesday as the stock jumped nearly 5% to ₹3,577.95 following a 20% YoY growth in the company’s consumer businesses for Q2 FY26. Her 5.15% holding (4.57 crore shares) is now valued at approximately ₹16,384 crore, up from ₹15,646 crore at Tuesday’s close.

items.title: Sebi taking measures to ensure system safety in quantum computing era: Pandey
items.description: Advent of quantum computing can lead to big security challenges, and Sebi is engaged in preparing the system to be safe ahead of its adoption, the capital market regulator's chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said on Wednesday.

items.title: Auto stocks: Festive and GST push is one part, a possible inflection point is bigger: 9 auto stocks with upside potential of up to 25%
items.description: While festive sales offer a temporary boost, the long-term performance of auto stocks hinges on declining battery costs and widespread EV charging infrastructure. Investors should watch for companies with ready product ranges and strong distribution networks as the EV market matures.

items.title: Multibaggers: 15 Smallcap stocks surge up to 225% in just 3 months. Are they in your Portfolio?
items.description: Over the past three months, the BSE Smallcap Index has struggled, slipping nearly 3%, while the benchmark Sensex also declined—though to a slightly lesser extent. Despite this overall market weakness, a few small-cap stocks have bucked the trend spectacularly. Around 23 smallcap companies not only stayed afloat but soared, delivering gains of 50%–225%. Two stocks more than doubled investors’ wealth in three months. Amid this challenging period, 15 small-caps rose over 60%, proving strong returns are possible even in a declining market. (Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: EPFO to make Rs 17,000 crore profit if allowed to redeem these 2 ETFs
items.description: EPFO plans to redeem CPSE and Bharat 22 ETF investments in FY26, potentially generating Rs 17,237 crore gains, while extending other ETF tenures and revamping IT via EPFO 3.0.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday
items.description: Indian markets paused their four-day winning streak on Wednesday, with Nifty down 62 points and Sensex 153 points. Weakness in banks outweighed IT gains amid profit booking and pre-earnings caution.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy Aster DM Healthcare and a smallcap stock on Thursday for up to 12% gains
items.description: Benchmark index Nifty snapped its four-day winning streak on Wednesday, ending lower amid weakness in auto, pharma, and banking stocks. Markets traded sideways on Wednesday, taking a breather after the recent surge and charts suggest further consolidation.Commenting on the current trends, Ajit Mishra, Senior Vice President - Research at Religare Broking, said that he sees the Nifty bias remaining positive despite today's losses. "We continue to maintain a buy-on-dips strategy and recommend focusing on opportunities with a favorable risk-reward setup, particularly within sectors showing consistent relative strength such as auto, metals, and PSUs, while remaining selective in others," Mishra said. Here are 2 stock recommendations for Thursday:

items.title: Saatvik Green Energy reports stellar Q1 after tepid listing as PAT skyrockets 459% YoY, revenue soars 272%
items.description: Saatvik Green Energy reported a 459% YoY jump in Q1FY26 net profit at Rs 119 crore, with revenue up 272% to Rs 916 crore. Shares surged 10% to Rs 506 after its September IPO.

items.title: Sebi raises minimum block deal size to Rs 25 crore, mandates delivery-only trades. Check key takeaways
items.description: Sebi increased the minimum block deal size from Rs 10 crore to Rs 25 crore and mandated delivery-based settlement. Trades must stay within ±3% of reference prices, with updated surveillance and trading window rules effective in 60 days.

items.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq advance ahead of Fed remarks
items.description: U.S. stocks edged higher as investors awaited Federal Reserve commentary for interest-rate clues amid a government shutdown.  Gold's surge to record highs highlighted a growing appetite for safe havens against policy risks and a shaky economic outlook. Tech stocks led gains, while energy and some financials faced pressure.

items.title: The ₹3.5 lakh cr mystery: Inside India’s hidden bank of unclaimed wealth
items.description: Over ₹3.5 lakh crore of Indians’ money lies forgotten — in old bank accounts, unpaid insurance claims, unclaimed dividends, and dormant pensions. These are not just numbers; they’re life savings lost in the system. Now, the government is finally stepping in. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has launched “Your Money, Your Right” — a nationwide campaign to help citizens reclaim what’s rightfully theirs. Meanwhile, the Supreme Court has asked regulators like RBI, SEBI, and IRDAI to create a single portal to trace unclaimed funds.Watch as we break down the numbers, the reform push, and the next big step toward financial justice.

items.title: Utkarsh Bank announces Rs 950-cr rights issue at 37.5% discount
items.description: Utkarsh Small Finance Bank set its Rs 950-crore rights issue at Rs 14 per share, a 37.5% discount. The issue covers 68 crore shares amid declining stock prices since 2024.

items.title: High-return stars! 6 largecap stocks with over 50% ROCE in FY25
items.description: A high Return on Capital Employed (ROCE) indicates that a company is using its capital efficiently to generate strong profits. It reflects effective management and the company’s ability to earn attractive returns from both equity and debt investments. In simple terms, a higher ROCE means the business is making good use of its resources. We have highlighted six large-cap stocks with over 50% ROCE in FY25, according to StocksEdge’s Profitable Scan data.ROCE = (Earnings Before Interest and Tax / Capital Employed) × 100. EBIT is the company's Earnings Before Interest and Taxes, and Capital Employed is the total capital used to generate profits, often calculated as Total Assets - Current Liabilities.

items.title: Canara Bank, Aster DM Healthcare among 7 stocks hit 52-week high; gain up to 17% in a month
items.description: On Wednesday, the benchmark Sensex fell around 153 points, closing at 81,773. Despite the market dip, seven stocks from the BSE 500 index reached their 52-week highs — the highest levels they’ve seen in the past year. Traders and investors often view such breakouts as bullish signals, indicating strong upward momentum and the possibility of further gains.

items.title: Anant Raj Ltd to raise Rs 1,100 crore via QIP
items.description: Realty developer Anant Raj plans to raise ₹1,100 crore through a Qualified Institutional Placement to fund expansion and development projects, focusing on its fast-growing data centre and cloud infrastructure arm. The company targets $1 billion in revenue from this segment by FY32, supported by government policy incentives and rising digital demand.

items.title: Stock Radar: Why Lemon Tree Hotels stock is looking a good ‘buy on dips’ stock
items.description: Lemon Tree Hotels Ltd has shown resilience, rebounding after a mild correction with its previous resistance now acting as support. Experts suggest buying the stock for a potential target above 180 levels in the coming weeks, citing positive price action and momentum indicators.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Titan and Vijay Kedia stock among 8 scrips under spotlight on Wednesday
Market Wrap: Sensex dips 153 points, Nifty slips below 25,050 as profit-taking ends 4-day rally
items.description: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty eased on Wednesday, snapping a four-session winning run, as investors booked profits, with financial shares leading losses. The weakness in banks outweighed gains in IT stocks ahead of the quarterly results.

items.title: Newly-listed stock soars 8% to hit record high after new order wins worth Rs 707 crore
items.description: Saatvik Green Energy shares surged over 8% to a record Rs 499 after securing two new solar PV module orders worth Rs 707 crore. Listed in September, the company’s revenue and profits have grown sharply, supported by capacity expansion and rising domestic solar demand.

items.title: These mid-cap stocks with ‘Strong Buy’ & ‘Buy’ recos can rally over 28%, according to analysts
items.description: When the underlying bias of the market has changed from bearish to bullish, then volatility should be used to enter the stock market. There is no point fearing volatility. One of the reasons why we are working with underlying bullish assumptions is the fact that, unlike the past when the market used to look at immediate quarterly earnings, the focus of the street is on Q3 numbers, rather than Q2 earnings. Now given the fact that a large number of companies are giving positive business updates and showing confidence, there is good enough reason to be positive. ET Screener, powered by Refinitiv’s Stock Report Plus, lists quality stocks with high upside potential over the next 12 months, and having an average recommendation rating of “Buy” or "Strong Buy".

items.title: Multibagger or IBC - Part 27: With history on its side, will this company be able to pass the modern EV test and create value?
items.description: From humble beginnings in the 1930s to a listed small-cap today, this company’s journey mirrors the evolution of India’s auto ancillary sector. Its scale now spans domestic networks and exports while an OEM client base secures steady demand. Financially, it has delivered: EPS up 12x since FY10, dividends steadily rising, reserves multiplying, and debt reducing despite multiple investment cycles. For the auto ancillary sector, however, the big story is EV disruption. Some parts of the traditional kit lose relevance, but others remain relevant. This series on auto ancillary companies works with the assumption that, from the whole set of auto ancillary companies, some multibagger stocks will emerge. And some companies in this space risk going bankrupt.
